TopicTitle: question on getting asteroids to have custom resources.

Articles.Content:
Hey, I've been tinkering around with asteroids for fun. I had a question. By modifying custom asteroid's orbit mechanics, I managed to get a custom set of asteroids. But I have no idea how to tell KSP to give these custom asteroids, only certain kinds of resources other than ore. Could someone walk me through this or give a hint or two?

Additionally, how would I get a custom model for this? I tried modifying the potatoroid files from squad, but I've no idea to get these custom potatoes to be used in these custom orbits.

I've been watching to see if anyone has an answer - appears not. The only asteroid mod I've seen (AMT by RoverDude) modifies all asteroid resources not just one group. I haven't seen anything on changing the potatoroid model.

Yea this is my problem. I want to create a new type of asteroid, set to a unique zone of space, with its own unique resources. This is most difficult to understand how to do

I've got the orbit set up, and asteroids to spawn there, but they are just normal potatoes. I want my Sweet potatoes!

Don't know if this is relevant but found some likely looking classes in the KSP API github http://anatid.github.io/XML-Documentation-for-the-KSP-API/annotated.html. PAsteroid and ProceduralAsteroid caught my eye - no idea what they actually do.
